segment.source: View and organize the Windows Defender ATP Alerts queue
segment.target: View and organize the Windows Defender ATP Alerts queue

segment.source: Learn about how the Windows Defender ATP alerts queue work, and how to sort and filter lists of alerts.
segment.target: Learn about how the Windows Defender ATP alerts queue work, and how to sort and filter lists of alerts.

segment.source: View and organize the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Alerts queue
segment.target: View and organize the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Alerts queue

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]

segment.source: As a security operations team member, you can manage Windows Defender ATP alerts as part of your routine activities.
segment.target: As a security operations team member, you can manage Windows Defender ATP alerts as part of your routine activities.

segment.source: Alerts will appear in queues according to their current status.
segment.target: Alerts will appear in queues according to their current status.

segment.source: To see a list of alerts, click any of the queues under the Alerts queue option in the navigation pane.
segment.target: To see a list of alerts, click any of the queues under the Alerts queue option in the navigation pane.

segment.source: Note By default, the queues are sorted from newest to oldest.
segment.target: Note By default, the queues are sorted from newest to oldest.

segment.source: The following table and screenshot demonstrate the main areas of the Alerts queue.
segment.target: The following table and screenshot demonstrate the main areas of the Alerts queue.

segment.source: Screenshot of the Dashboard showing the New Alerts list and navigation bar
segment.target: Screenshot of the Dashboard showing the New Alerts list and navigation bar

segment.source: Highlighted area
segment.target: Highlighted area

segment.source: Area name
segment.target: Area name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Alerts queue
segment.target: Alerts queue

segment.source: Select to show New, In Progress, or Resolved alerts
segment.target: Select to show New, In Progress, or Resolved alerts

segment.source: Alerts
segment.target: Alerts

segment.source: Each alert shows:
segment.target: Each alert shows:

segment.source: The severity of an alert as a colored bar
segment.target: The severity of an alert as a colored bar

segment.source: A short description of the alert, including the name of the threat actor (in cases where the attribution is possible)
segment.target: A short description of the alert, including the name of the threat actor (in cases where the attribution is possible)

segment.source: The last occurrence of the alert on any machine
segment.target: The last occurrence of the alert on any machine

segment.source: The number of days the alert has been in the queue
segment.target: The number of days the alert has been in the queue

segment.source: The severity of the alert
segment.target: The severity of the alert

segment.source: The general category or type of alert, or the alert's kill-chain stage
segment.target: The general category or type of alert, or the alert's kill-chain stage

segment.source: The affected machine (if there are multiple machines, the number of affected machines will be shown)
segment.target: The affected machine (if there are multiple machines, the number of affected machines will be shown)

segment.source: A Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other that allows you to update the alert's status and add comments
segment.target: A Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other that allows you to update the alert's status and add comments

segment.source: Clicking an alert expands to display more information about the threat and brings you to the date in the timeline when the alert was detected.
segment.target: Clicking an alert expands to display more information about the threat and brings you to the date in the timeline when the alert was detected.

segment.source: Alerts sorting and filters
segment.target: Alerts sorting and filters

segment.source: You can sort alerts by:
segment.target: You can sort alerts by:

segment.source: Newest (when the threat was last seen on your network)
segment.target: Newest (when the threat was last seen on your network)

segment.source: Time in queue (how long the threat has been in your queue)
segment.target: Time in queue (how long the threat has been in your queue)

segment.source: Severity
segment.target: Severity

segment.source: You can also filter the displayed alerts by:
segment.target: You can also filter the displayed alerts by:

segment.source: Severity
segment.target: Severity

segment.source: Time period
segment.target: Time period

segment.source: See Windows Defender ATP alerts for more details.
segment.target: See Windows Defender ATP alerts for more details.

segment.source: Sort and filter the Alerts queue
segment.target: Sort and filter the Alerts queue

segment.source: You can filter and sort (or "pivot") the Alerts queue to identify specific alerts based on certain criteria.
segment.target: You can filter and sort (or "pivot") the Alerts queue to identify specific alerts based on certain criteria.

segment.source: There are three mechanisms to pivot the queue against:
segment.target: There are three mechanisms to pivot the queue against:

segment.source: Sort the queue by opening the drop-down menu in the Sort by field and choosing:
segment.target: Sort the queue by opening the drop-down menu in the Sort by field and choosing:

segment.source: Newest - Sorts alerts based on when the alert was last seen on an endpoint.
segment.target: Newest - Sorts alerts based on when the alert was last seen on an endpoint.

segment.source: Time in queue - Sorts alerts by the length of time an alert has been in the queue.
segment.target: Time in queue - Sorts alerts by the length of time an alert has been in the queue.

segment.source: Severity - Sorts alerts by their level of severity.
segment.target: Severity - Sorts alerts by their level of severity.

segment.source: Filter alerts by their Severity by opening the drop-down menu in the Filter by field and selecting one or more of the check boxes:
segment.target: Filter alerts by their Severity by opening the drop-down menu in the Filter by field and selecting one or more of the check boxes:

segment.source: High (Red) - Threats often associated with advanced persistent threats (APT).
segment.target: High (Red) - Threats often associated with advanced persistent threats (APT).

segment.source: These alerts indicate a high risk due to the severity of damage they can inflict on endpoints.
segment.target: These alerts indicate a high risk due to the severity of damage they can inflict on endpoints.

segment.source: Medium (Orange) - Threats rarely observed in the organization, such as anomalous registry change, execution of suspicious files, and observed behaviors typical of attack stages.
segment.target: Medium (Orange) - Threats rarely observed in the organization, such as anomalous registry change, execution of suspicious files, and observed behaviors typical of attack stages.

segment.source: Low (Yellow) - Threats associated with prevalent malware and hack-tools that do not appear to indicate an advanced threat targeting the organization.
segment.target: Low (Yellow) - Threats associated with prevalent malware and hack-tools that do not appear to indicate an advanced threat targeting the organization.

segment.source: Limit the queue to see alerts from various set periods by clicking the drop-down menu in the date range field (by default, this is selected as 6 months):
segment.target: Limit the queue to see alerts from various set periods by clicking the drop-down menu in the date range field (by default, this is selected as 6 months):

segment.source: 1 day
segment.target: 1 day

segment.source: 3 days
segment.target: 3 days

segment.source: 7 days
segment.target: 7 days

segment.source: 30 days
segment.target: 30 days

segment.source: 6 months
segment.target: 6 months

segment.source: Note You can change the sort order (for example, from most recent to least recent) by clicking the sort order icon the sort order icon looks like two arrows on top of each other
segment.target: Note You can change the sort order (for example, from most recent to least recent) by clicking the sort order icon the sort order icon looks like two arrows on top of each other
